Client and Risk Analyst, Business Banking

Company Name Macquarie Group Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 68 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

An exciting opportunity currently exists to join Macquarie Business Banking as a Client and Risk Analyst in Melbourne.

As a specialist provider of business banking we are able to tailor unique and highly service driven solutions for our clients. As a Client and Risk Analyst, you will be responsible for the ongoing analysis of business banking lending exposures.

You will partner with our relationship and business development managers to create a trusted advisor relationship between the bank and client. You will also produce timely and accurate credit submissions that assess counterparty risk including annual reviews, increase lending, and new to bank lending.

Key to your success will be your genuine passion and experience as a Credit Analyst within Business Banking, with a proven ability to understand complex business structures. In addition, you will possess a strong client focus, exceptional stakeholder management skills and strong numerical and analytical skills.

This is an exciting time to join our growing team, where you can be a key driver in enacting change and influencing growth. Macquarie Business Banking are committed to long term growth and this will open up opportunities for career development in a forward thinking organisation that invests in its people.

If you possess the above skills and experience and are looking to take the next step in your career, please submit an application online. For a confidential discussion, please contact Georgie Brown on (03) 9635 8891.

Banking and Financial Services Group comprises Macquarie's retail banking and financial services businesses, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management and business banking products and services to retail customers, advisers, brokers and business clients.

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility is available.

Group: Banking and Financial Services

Law Clerk (Professional Standards & Risk)

Company Name Slater and Gordon Lawyers Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 23 hours ago Number of views 50 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Law Clerk (Professional Standards and Risk)

The opportunity and role

An exciting opportunity exists to join Slater and Gordon Lawyers in the role of a Law Clerk on a 12 month fixed term contract. The role will have you work within the Professional Standards & Risk and In-house Legal team of Slater and Gordon Lawyers.

Reporting directly to the General Manager of Professional Standards & Risk, you will:
  • Implement a centralised file transfer processes to manage all aspects of file transfers.
  • Liaise with our legal teams, external solicitors and clients to manage the terms of transfer.
  • Collaborate with our legal teams to oversee file transfers in an efficient, secure and professional manner. This will include preparing files for transfer and maintaining records of transferred files.
  • Monitor the recovery of legal costs and disbursements in relation to transferred files.
  • Provide administrative support to Professional Standards & Risk
To be successful

You will have prior experience as a law clerk or paralegal, particularly in the area of personal injury law firm would be an advantage. The role requires the development of expertise regarding professional obligations and best practice in relation to file transfers across Victoria, New South Wales, Queensland and Western Australia.

A strong communicator, you are solutions focussed with a practical approach to your work. You will need sound professional judgement to deal with a range of internal and external stakeholders with sensitivity and acumen. You will also need strong organisational and time-management skills and the drive to make a difference.

You will form part of the experienced and collegiate Professional Standards & Risk team based in the Melbourne office. This is a small and dynamic team in which every person plays a pivotal role. You will also collaborate closely with management and staff in the practice areas of the business and with staff in our Finance department.

Both full-time and part-time applications will be considered.

To apply

If you are interested in this opportunity please apply directly to Slater and Gordon. We prefer to liaise with you personally and are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.

About Us

Slater and Gordon is a leading consumer law firm. Our aim is to guide our clients to a brighter outcome by being passionate advocates of their best interests and champions of every client's cause.

We offer our employees a genuine opportunity for career development in a supportive work environment.

Slater and Gordon value high performance. We recognise the contribution of our employees and reward them with a dedicated range of attractive benefits.

Occupations Manager

Company Name Metro Trains Melbourne Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 13 hours ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Great career opportunities
  • High-profile project work
  • Clayton South Location

Metro Trains Melbourne is a multi-award winning organisation and we pride ourselves on our team of high performing professionals who are talented, inclusive and safety focused.

We are currently seeking an Occupations Manager with proven project management skills in delivery multi discipline works, for work on our Level Crossing Removal Projects.This large-scale program of works will benefit train users, pedestrians, cyclists and drivers by improving safety, reducing congestion and enabling more frequent train services.

In this role, you will plan, direct, manage and monitor all project Rail Access and Occupations so far as practicably reasonable so as to minimise their effect on train operations whilst ensuring that construction requirements are met.

Accountabilities

  • Manage access permits and coordinate the requirements for all required occupations, including overhead personnel, overhead safety observers and other relevant compliance personnel.
  • Produce occupation coordination documents such as Occupation Works Guide, workgroup site plan, manage the occupation schedule and shift plans.
  • Chair occupation coordination forums including weekly workgroup reviews, site walks, and lessons learnt.
  • Provide advice and assistance to the project delivery teams for the development, review of delivery strategies and provide advice and guidance on the impact that occupations are likely to have on train operations.
  • Interface & coordinate the involvement non-Alliance MTM works in project meetings, workshops and the like.
  • Ensure all accepted Occupation Applications are ‘Requested’ accurately and in a timely manner.
  • Provide on-site support and undertake audits.
  • Represent the project at client meetings.

    • To be successful in the role, your previous experience will include:

  • Previous construction experience is essential.
  • Project Management certificate is desirable.
  • Rail Industry Card is desirable.
  • Management experience.
  • Experience in the railway construction industry with an understanding of the complexities of construction within the railway corridor.
  • Ability to challenge methods, timing and strategies proposed.
  • Report writing skills using MS Word & Power Point.
  • Intermediate skills level in Excel.
  • Familiar with Primavera.
  • Confident in delivering presentations to large groups and taking the lead in meetings, workshops & reviews.

    • Why work for Metro?

  • Career development opportunities.
  • Growing employer with exciting project work in the pipeline
  • Free public transport in Victoria.

    • This is an excellent opportunity to take the next step in your career and make a tangible impact on Melbourne’s rail infrastructure. If what you’ve read resonates with your values, experience and career aspiration then we want to hear from you! Please submit your application by COB Tuesday 25 September 2018.

    Metro Trains is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We encourage all interested applicants to apply but please note - only applications with the right to live and work in Australia will be considered for this position.

Experienced Construction Engineer

Company Name SMEC Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 20 hours ago Number of views 69 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Flexible and friendly working environment, plus vehicle (tool of trade utility)
  • New premium Melbourne CBD office location: Collins Square, 5 minutes walk from Southern Cross Station
  • Outstanding career prospects


About SMEC

SMEC has joined forces with Surbana Jurong to provide global engineering and consultancy expertise in urban, infrastructure and management advisory. Our new partnership has created a talent pool of 14,000 dedicated people working across a network of 95 offices in 40 countries.

SMEC employs passionate and innovative people who are driven to deliver exceptional outcomes and who want to feel valued in a diverse and inclusive workplace.

We are committed to developing our people. We encourage them to see things differently, to be creative and to push boundaries.


The role

Due to sustained growth we are seeking a talented Experienced Construction Engineer\xa0to work closely with our other specialists to in our high performing Urban Engineering team.

With say 5+ years experience, you'll play a key role project managing and coordinating the construction phase of major urban development projects.\xa0


Core responsibilities include:


  • Maintain a high level of technical expertise, in particular in construction methods, materials, equipment and techniques
  • Preempt and resolve on-site construction problems
  • Monitor construction progress against program
  • Approve payment of contractors progress claims and contract variations up to specified limits
  • Maintain a high level of technical expertise, in particular construction methods, equipment and techniques
  • Ensure the proper and accurate two-way flow of information in relation to allocated projects
  • Comply with the requirements described in the respective roles and responsibilities
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications


With a track record of achievement in a similar role, you'll ideally have gained your experience in a similar engineering design consultancy and have a passion for building trusted relationships to drive positive change and win new work.


Suitable applicants will have/be:


  • Urban development experience
  • Degree qualified


In return, SMEC offers you the benefits that come from working in a global multidisciplinary consultancy in an environment where your fresh ideas and enthusiasm will be welcomed and rewarded.


SMEC Melbourne's new premium offices!


Our Melbourne office has relocated to Collins Square to better serve our clients.
Address Tower 4, Level 20, 727 Collins Street Docklands VIC 3008


How to apply

To apply via our website, click on the link http://careers.smec.com/aw/en/job/501997?lApplicationSubSourceID=\xa0and follow the onlin prompts. Alternatively,\xa0please contact David Wood tel. 03 9869 0920 / email david.wood@smec.com.


To find out more about SMEC, please visit our careers page at www.smec.com/careers


All recruitment activities go through our Resourcing function and currently, this role doesn’t require agency input. Please do not forward resumes directly to SMEC employees/managers; we do not accept unsolicited resumes and are not responsible for any associated fees.

Senior Commercial & Contract Manager

Company Name Telstra Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago Number of views 77 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

World Class organisations are driven by a sense of purpose... Our purpose is to create a brilliant connected future for everyone! Our ambition is to enrich lives and power commerce. It's why we're constantly finding better ways to serve our customers and why we're building new ways to support our clients doing business.

To support such a vision, we are currently seeking to an exceptional Senior Commercial & Contract Manager who will operate as part of the dynamic, responsive and supportive Commercial and Contract Operations team negotiating, managing and consulting on significant and complex Transformation contracts with the purpose of achieving Global Services (GS) revenue, profitability and NPS targets.

This is a full time permanent role and we are looking for the Senior Commercial & Contract Manager to start in our Melbourne office only.

A Little Bit About The Role

Reporting into the Group Commercial Manager, your primary role will be to establish sound commercial and contract management practices, including processes and procures, relationship establishment and governance within Telstra’s BP account. Your day to day direction and advice will be to the Account Executive team, Program and Service Delivery leads, providing your extensive commercial knowledge, guidance and commercial governance to a high profile and critical account.

The Senior Commercial & Contract Manager will be responsible for
  • Building strong and effective relationships with internal operational stakeholders (Sales, Pricing, Billing, and Delivery) to support contract deliverables
  • Drafting, collating, and approving contract variation, commercial correspondence and associated documentation
  • Negotiating contract variations, project proposals, SOWs and other commercial documents to provide optimum commercial outcomes
  • Ensuring legal compliance and review contract changes for commercial risks
  • Identification of mitigation of risks regarding cost, delivery, service levels associated with the Services
  • Act as a commercial escalation point and liaise with offshore contract management support team to provide a comprehensive contract management function to the region

Think you’ve got what it takes to take on a challenging yet fulfilling role? And if you are keen in your next role to have a platform in which you can demonstrate some commercial management abilities to contribute directly towards company growth and improvements in order to provide a fantastic service then please take the next step and connect to a future created by you today.

In order to hit the ground running we are looking for individuals who can confidently demonstrate the following
  • Demonstrated experience in being an agent of change and building trust amongst stakeholders, clients and third parties
  • Extensive demonstrated experience managing and/or negotiating complex Information Communications Technology (ICT) contracts and associated service level agreements and/or project solutions/offers and ensuring a least risk commercial outcome
  • Demonstrated persuasion, commercial management and negotiation skills and experience within complex commercial arrangements
  • Applied experience in providing service delivery commercial advice, service level interpretation and management, project proposal assessments and transformation commercial management
  • Good project management skills with the proven ability to manage multiple issues/projects simultaneously, manage stakeholder engagement and meet tight deadlines
  • High degree of numeracy with financial awareness and ability to provide analytical support to the development of proposals and offers
  • Commercial experience in a telecommunications environment
  • Experience in working with a remote team to provide consolidated and unified support to internal stakeholders
    It's no secret that we expect a lot from you. A job at Telstra is like no other you've had. You'll be challenged, you’ll be inspired and you'll be proud. Because whatever your job is here, you'll always be part of something bigger. Come and connect with what you love and apply now!


Benefits And Career Path

A career at Telstra can lead down many paths. There is a variety of roles to suit all sorts of skills, but you will also have the chance to learn from the best people every day. Not only will you be rewarded with a competitive salary package, but there are a range of lifestyle products and services that you can access through our “my rewards” program, options to purchase additional leave, paid parental leave and the list goes on. And in case you haven't heard we're well known in the market for our best in class flexible working practices!

We work flexibly at Telstra. Tell us how this job could be flexible for you.

We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit

Job description

We are seeking a talented professional to join our team in the role of Marketing Consultant. This is an exciting opportunity to support the team and wider firm in the delivery of marketing plans and campaigns. Further responsibilities will include:

\xa0

  • Drive the use of digital channels, social media and podcasts to build the firm’s reputation for insight and thought leadership in chosen areas.
  • Ensure marketing content is developed in line with our content development principles
  • Understand our clients and their needs to ensure our marketing activity is targeted and insightful.
  • Support Alumni Lead with managing the global alumni program, including alumni registrations, implementing marketing activities across digital and events.
  • Build and maintain relationships with Partners and fee earners, and the wider Business Development, Digital, Design, Events, and Communications teams, including agencies to ensure effective implementation of marketing programmes.
  • Stakeholder management with external agencies to ensure assets are delivered on time and are brand compliant
  • Be a brand ambassador for all communications and provide guidance and training where appropriate.
  • Actively source and share knowledge with the wider Brand, Marketing and Digital team through internal and external best practice examples.
  • Have a hands-on approach to the day-to-day running of marketing activities, responding to a wide range of marketing-related enquiries and acting as a helpful point of contact for stakeholders such as partners, associates, professional support lawyers, PAs, and business development specialists.

\xa0

In order to be successful in this role you will have marketing qualifications, approximately 5 years’ experience in a similar role (experience in a professional services firm highly regarded), excellent communication and influencing skills and a can-do attitude.
